img.alt: Lakota LEADS Announces 2020 Write Challenge Winners

div.div: Lakota LEADS Announces 2020 Write Challenge Winners

Lakota LEADS announced the winners of its annual Write Challenge, a district-wide writing contest open to students in grades K-12. Participants submitted a poem, narrative or essay responding to this year’s theme of “progress.”

a.title: Lakota LEADS Announces 2020 Write Challenge Winners

div.a: Read More About Lakota LEADS Announces 2020 Write Challenge Winners

img.alt: Specials Find Special Place in Remote Learning

div.div: Specials Find Special Place in Remote Learning

At a time when art, music, technology, exercise and creativity are a daily outlet to help offset the emotional toll of quarantine, Lakota’s “specials” teams are rallying to fuel their families’ idea banks. Called choice boards, flexible playlists or menu boards, their guiding purpose is all the same.

a.title: Specials Find Special Place in Remote Learning

div.a: Read More About Specials Find Special Place in Remote Learning

img.alt: Mental Health Video Series: Modeling Behaviors

div.div: Mental Health Video Series: Modeling Behaviors

Lakota’s emphasis on social, emotional and mental health has become even more pronounced as students, staff and our families start to feel the toll of our recent break in routine. Throughout this pandemic, Lakota is sharing brief video messages from our mental health experts on what small actions can help support our children and teenagers and keep their minds healthy and happy during these uncertain times.

a.title: Mental Health Video Series: Modeling Behaviors

div.a: Read More About Mental Health Video Series: Modeling Behaviors

img.alt: Real World Engineering Via Remote Learning

div.div: Real World Engineering Via Remote Learning

How do you make the jump from teaching about 130 students in a class that heavily relies on hands-on learning to remote learning? Joe Schorr, a Butler Tech teacher at the Lakota East Freshman building, has figured it out.

a.title: Real World Engineering Via Remote Learning

div.a: Read More About Real World Engineering Via Remote Learning

img.alt: Virtual Coffee Cart Keeps Learning Going

div.div: Virtual Coffee Cart Keeps Learning Going

Before remote learning Brianna, a freshman at Lakota East, would work on vocational skills by taking a coffee cart around to staff throughout the school building. Creative new ways to deliver instruction are emerging and now, just like so much other learning, the coffee cart that Brianna and her regular customers looked forward to each morning has gone virtual.

a.title: Virtual Coffee Cart Keeps Learning Going

div.a: Read More About Virtual Coffee Cart Keeps Learning Going

div.div: “Don your mask, don your cape." It’s a phrase we hear often from Dr. Amy Acton, Director of the Ohio Department of Health, about the heroic behavior of physical distancing. Masks can be hard to come by, but the Lakota community is stepping up in a big way to get face masks to those who need them.
div.a: Read More About Mask-Making: Lakota Gives Back

img.alt: Virtual Author Visit Adds Real World Learning to Novel Study

div.div: Virtual Author Visit Adds Real World Learning to Novel Study

When Independence Elementary fourth grade teacher Jenny Garwood realized she and her students would miss out on completing their latest class novel together, she resorted to the next best thing: Zoom. But the virtual class meeting doubled as real world learning when it included one more visitor than can be found on most online book discussions happening these days - the book’s author herself.

a.title: Virtual Author Visit Adds Real World Learning to Novel Study

div.a: Read More About Virtual Author Visit Adds Real World Learning to Novel Study

img.alt: Hopewell Junior NHS Challenged to Continue Spirit of Service

div.div: Hopewell Junior NHS Challenged to Continue Spirit of Service

Hopewell Junior Honor Society members are coming up with creative ways to continue their spirit of service – despite restrictions imposed by the pandemic. Their advisor, science teacher Mark Bauer, challenged them to share their good deeds with each other in a Google Drive folder.

a.title: Hopewell Junior NHS Challenged to Continue Spirit of Service

div.a: Read More About Hopewell Junior NHS Challenged to Continue Spirit of Service

img.alt: Remote Learning Continues through Academic Year

div.div: Remote Learning Continues through Academic Year

On Monday, April 20, Gov. DeWine announced that remote learning will continue for all Ohio schools through the end of the 2019-20 academic year. Below is the email from Superintendent Matthew Miller to all parents.

a.title: Remote Learning Continues through Academic Year

div.a: Read More About Remote Learning Continues through Academic Year

div.div: Everything WE do is designed to provide a future-ready, student-centered learning experience for every single child.
